title: How to Delete a Discord Voice or Text Channel on Android

steps.title: Open the Discord app.
steps.content: Open the Discord app. This looks like a white game controller in a blue circle on your Apps list. If you're not automatically signed into Discord on your device, enter your email and your password to log into your account now. If you want to delete a channel on a community or public server , you must be the server owner or have permission to do so. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to a server.
steps.content: Navigate to a server. If you don't see the list of servers, swipe towards the right to return to the Home tab.

steps.title: Tap a channel.
steps.content: Tap a channel. You will see a list of all chat channels on the left side of the server.

steps.title: Tap the channel name at the top.
steps.content: Tap the channel name at the top. This will be next to a hashtag.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This is the cog icon.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Delete Channel.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Delete Channel . This is at the very bottom of the page. If you don't see this option, or if it's grayed out, you don't have the proper permissions . You'll need to ask the server owner or an admin with proper permissions.

steps.title: Tap Yes.
steps.content: Tap Yes . This is the red button. The channel will be deleted, along with any messages within that channel.
